Authors:
Anuruddha Karunarathna , Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Dhanushka
Nadeeshan Wanasinghe, Nalin Wijayawardene, Kevin D Hyde
Title:
Taxonomy and phylogeny of Sparticola muriformis sp. nov. on
decaying grass
Abstract:
Members of Sporormiaceae are saprobes on plant debris,
wood, soil and dung and are sometimes endophytes. In this study, a
saprobic species was collected from decaying grass in China.
Maximum-parsimony, maximum-likelihood and Bayesian Inference analyses of
combined ITS, LSU, SSU, TEF-Î± and RPB2 sequence data clarified the
phylogenetic affinity in Sparticola. The isolate was confirmed as a new
species based on morphological and phylogenetic analyses. Sparticola
muriformis sp. nov. is distinguished from other taxa in Sporormiaceae by
having muriform ascospores.
